channel.title: Find dtm
channel.description:
OK I need help
On
[code]if findDTM(MyDTM, x, y,0,0,110,110) then[/code]
What do the numbers after x, y mean? How can I find them?
Thanks.

item.title: Find dtm
item.dc:creator: @script_owned script_owned
item.description:
@script_owned wrote:

[quote=“NCDS, post:2, topic:287883”]They are the coords that specify where the script searches for the DTM.

Open Scar and press F1 and it will open the Scar manual for you.[/quote]
scar manual sucks.

i would just follow a tutorial around here.

like ncds explained x and y r the coordiantes.

it searches the coordiantes for the dtm on ur screen.

leave it at x,y if u want it to search for the whole screen or change it.

Read full topic

item.title: Find dtm
item.dc:creator: @NCDS NCDS
item.description:
@NCDS wrote:

They are the coords that specify where the script searches for the DTM.

Open Scar and press F1 and it will open the Scar manual for you.

Read full topic
